Name: Requiring certain contracted entities to make public job training and employment data collected pursuant to projects in excess of $150,000.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain contracted entities to make public job training and employment data collected pursuant to projects in excess of $150,000.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council

Summary: This bill would alter the terms of the contract between the city and NYCEDC (“EDC”) by requiring EDC to include job training and employment data for projects over $150,000 in its annual report. Such report would need to include information regarding the number of city residents participating in training programs, the types of training opportunities made available, and the number of city residents offered employment after participating in training.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1. Subparagraph (h) of paragraph 2 of subdivision b of section 22-823 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
      (h) (1) The number of jobs that each person receiving assistance from such contracted entity is contractually obligated to retain and create over the duration of the project agreement or, in the case of a project agreement that contains annual job retention or creation requirements, the annual job retention or creation requirement for the reporting year;
      (2) The base employment level such entity agrees to retain over the duration of the project agreement;
      (3) Any job creation scheduled to take place as a result of such project;
      (4) Where applicable, any job creation targets for the reporting year; and
      (5) The details of any job training opportunities created for such project, including (i) the number of city residents participating in training programs; (ii) the types of training opportunities made available, including skills taught and certifications provided; and (iii) the number of city residents offered employment after participating in training, disaggregated by full-time and part-time positions.

      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
